wifi_version.description:
Wi-Fi operation mode:
`1` = Wi-Fi 1 (802.11b) (Only 2.4 GHz),
`2` = Wi-Fi 2 (IEEE 802.11a) (Only 5 GHz),
`3` = Wi-Fi 3 (IEEE 802.11g) (only 2.4 GHz),
`4` = Wi-Fi 4 (IEEE 802.11n) (2.4/5 GHz),
`5` = Wi-Fi 5 (IEEE 802.11ac) (only 5 GHz),
`6` = Wi-Fi 6/6E (IEEE 802.11ax) (2.4/5 GHz for Wi-Fi 6, 2.4/5/6 GHz for Wi-Fi 6E),
`7` = Wi-Fi 7 (IEEE 802.11be) (2.4/5/6 GHz)

band.description: Wi-Fi Operating frequency: `2.4` OR `5`. The default should be fine. 6 GHz is NOT supported!

country_code.description: Wi-Fi Country code (ISO/IEC 3166-1). Used to set regulatory domain. Set as needed to indicate country in which device is operating. This can limit available channels and transmit power.

wpa_passphrase.description: Wi-Fi password used as the WPA pre-shared key (WPA-PSK)

ble_password.description: BLE password to communicate with companion app, please set it on app too

logfile.description: Log file path, by default it is saved to `/var/log` in `tmpfs`/memory. If you want, you can change it e.g. to `/data/aa-proxy-rs.log` and it will be saved to SD card (appended, not replaced).

stats_interval.description: Interval of showing data transfer statistics in the log (0 = disabled) [seconds]

timeout_secs.description: Data transfer timeout [seconds], after this idle time the session will be reconnected

legacy.description: Enable legacy USB mode (some HeadUnits/cars needs this enabled for compatibility)

quick_reconnect.description: EXPERIMENTAL: Maintain persistent Bluetooth connection to enable faster reconnection with MD

wired.description:
Enable wired USB connection to phone (VID:PID should be specified, zero is wildcard and can be used for single or both fields)
you can obtain it e.g. using `lsusb` after connecting phone,
and then use e.g. "18d1:0" which will handle specified phone vendor ID (Google Pixel in this example)

udc.description: UDC Controller name (used in special configurations)

startup_delay.description:
Enables delaying the launch of `aa-proxy-rs` by a specified number of seconds (range: 0‚Äì254).
Default value: 0.
Intended for specific scenarios (e.g., non-standard head units)

hexdump_level.description: Hex dump level [possible values: Disabled, DecryptedInput, RawInput, DecryptedOutput, RawOutput, All]

disable_console_debug.description: Disable debug level on console, save it only to logfile (helpful for `hexdump-level` option)

enable_btle.description: Enable BLE/GATT server for companion app

btalias.description:
Bluetooth device name/alias (how your bluetooth device is visible)
by default it is `aa-proxy-CPUSERIAL`
for dongle mode you need to set it to: `AndroidAuto-xxxxx`

connect.description:
Auto-connect to phone and initiate connection
empty string/no value: don't auto-connect,
zeros: iterate over all previously connected devices,
may be set to a comma seperated list of phone BT MAC addresses for connecting to a specific list of phones, wildcard may not be used with list

bt_timeout_secs.description: Bluetooth handshake timeout [seconds], this is for rare cases when the phone stops responding, to prevent the bluetooth handshake deadlock with inifite waiting and not restarting connection again

iface.description: WLAN / Wi-Fi Hotspot interface (for obtaining IP and BSSID)

change_usb_order.description: Connect to HU USB before Bluetooth handshake

bt_poweroff.description: Powers off the Bluetooth adapter after the handshake. Intended for use only in specific configurations

mitm.description: Enable MITM mode. This must be enabled for all options below to take effect.

dpi.description:
Force DPI
0 = do not change DPI
If you are unsure what value to use, start experimenting with e.g. 130. Logs are helpful, as they show both the original HU value and the new one.

audio_max_unacked.description:
Override the `max_unacked` setting for audio channels. This may improve audio performance on some head units, but may worsen it on others. Adjust this value experimentally only if you experience audio stuttering.
0 = leave unchanged.

remove_tap_restriction.description: Remove tap restrictions. This affects situations where tapping too frequently while driving triggers a temporary lockout warning. Might not work, depending on phone and Android version.

video_in_motion.description: Enable video playback while driving. Intended for passengers only - do not watch video while driving. Might not work, depending on phone and Android version. In some cases, this also requires `developer_mode` to be enabled below.

disable_media_sink.description: Disable the media sink. This prevents regular audio from being routed to the head unit (it stays on the phone), allowing, for example, a passenger to watch YouTube locally on the phone with audio.

disable_tts_sink.description: Disable the TTS sink. Similar to the option above, but navigation voice guidance is not routed to the head unit and remains on the phone.

developer_mode.description: Enable developer mode. This option emulates a Google Head Unit, allowing installation and use of applications that are normally unavailable. Commonly used by developers when testing or developing new applications.

remove_bluetooth.description: Remove the Bluetooth service from the `service discovery response`. This option may be helpful for head units with integrated wireless Android Auto.

remove_wifi.description: Remove the Wi-Fi service from the `service discovery response`. This option may be helpful for head units with integrated wireless Android Auto.

stop_on_disconnect.description: Stop automatic reconnection after manually selecting `Disconnect` in Android Auto on the phone. aa-proxy will not attempt to reconnect until the next restart or until a Bluetooth connection is initiated manually from the phone.

waze_lht_workaround.description: Enable a Waze workaround for LHT (Left-Hand Traffic) countries by swapping U_TURN_LEFT with U_TURN_RIGHT in navigation and HUD.

ev_battery_logger.description:
Path to executable for providing EV battery data (e.g. from an OBD dongle). It is started automatically when an Android Auto session begins and terminated when the session ends.
Any parameters provided at the end of the path are passed to the executable as-is.

ev_connector_types.description:
List of EV connector types supported by your car. Possible values (separate multiple with a comma ','):
EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_J1772, EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_MENNEKES, EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_CHADEMO, EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_COMBO_1, EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_COMBO_2, EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_TESLA_SUPERCHARGER, EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_GBT

If left empty, the default is EV_CONNECTOR_TYPE_MENNEKES.

dhu.description: Use a Google Android Auto Desktop Head Unit emulator instead of real HU device (will listen on TCP 5277 port). For usage without a real SBC!

eth_mode.description:
Configure Ethernet mode (optional). Options:
- `DHCP` (case-insensitive): dynamic IP assignment
- Static IP: e.g. `192.168.100.1/24`
- Leave blank to disable

usb_serial_console.description: Enables the USB serial gadget (ttyGS0) for low-level console debugging. This should be disabled during normal Android Auto operation.
